00028 ###############################################################################
00029 #
00030 #  A first version of a set of elliptic cylinders. Already works in the
00031 #  geometry viewer, but still need to run it through the geometry tester. The
00032 #  hard part for that type of geometry is hownear() (requires to solve a 4'th
00033 #  order equation).
00034 #
00035 ###############################################################################
00036 */
00037 
00038 
00044 #include "egs_elliptic_cylinders.h"
00045 #include "egs_input.h"
00046 
00047 extern "C" {
00048 
00049     EGS_ELLIPTIC_CYLINDERS_EXPORT
00050     EGS_BaseGeometry *createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00051         // check for valid input
00052         if (!input) {
00053             egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): null input?\n");
00054             return 0;
00055         }
00056         string type;
00057         int err = input->getInput("type",type);
00058         if (err) {
00059             egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): missing type key\n");
00060             return 0;
00061         }
00062 
00063         // point on cylinder axis
00064         EGS_Vector xo;
00065         vector<EGS_Float> Xo;
00066         err = input->getInput("midpoint",Xo);
00067         if (!err && Xo.size() == 3) {
00068             xo = EGS_Vector(Xo[0],Xo[1],Xo[2]);
00069         }
00070 
00071         // cylinder radii
00072         vector<EGS_Float> x_radii, y_radii;
00073         err = input->getInput("x-radii",x_radii);
00074         if (err) {
00075             egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): wrong/missing "
00076                        "'x-radii' input\n");
00077             return 0;
00078         }
00079         err = input->getInput("y-radii",y_radii);
00080         if (err) {
00081             egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): wrong/missing "
00082                        "'y-radii' input\n");
00083             return 0;
00084         }
00085         if (x_radii.size() != y_radii.size()) {
00086             egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): expecting the same "
00087                        "number of x- and y-radii, your input is %d %d\n",
00088                        x_radii.size(),y_radii.size());
00089             return 0;
00090         }
00091 
00092         // select geometry
00093         EGS_BaseGeometry *g;
00094         if (type == "EGS_EllipticCylindersXY")
00095             g = new EGS_EllipticCylindersXY(x_radii,y_radii,xo,"",
00096                                             EGS_XProjector("X"),EGS_YProjector("Y"));
00097         else if (type == "EGS_EllipticCylindersXZ")
00098             g = new EGS_EllipticCylindersXZ(x_radii,y_radii,xo,"",
00099                                             EGS_XProjector("X"),EGS_ZProjector("Z"));
00100         else if (type == "EGS_EllipticCylindersYZ")
00101             g = new EGS_EllipticCylindersYZ(x_radii,y_radii,xo,"",
00102                                             EGS_YProjector("Y"),EGS_ZProjector("Z"));
00103         else {
00104             vector<EGS_Float> ax, ay;
00105             err = input->getInput("x-axis",ax);
00106             if (err || ax.size() != 3) {
00107                 egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): missing/wrong "
00108                            "'x-axis' input\n");
00109                 return 0;
00110             }
00111             err = input->getInput("y-axis",ay);
00112             if (err || ay.size() != 3) {
00113                 egsWarning("createGeometry(elliptic cylinders): missing/wrong "
00114                            "'y-axis' input\n");
00115                 return 0;
00116             }
00117             g = new EGS_EllipticCylinders(x_radii,y_radii,xo,"",
00118                                           EGS_Projector(EGS_Vector(ax[0],ax[1],ax[2]),"Any"),
00119                                           EGS_Projector(EGS_Vector(ay[0],ay[1],ay[2]),""));
00120         }
00121         g->setName(input);
00122         g->setMedia(input);
00123         return g;
00124     }
00125 
00126 }
